hdj-EcAtNug9dchmsNP2JQ.text: Based on the location (rubbing elbows with the Tower of London), you'd expect this cafe to be both touristy and overpriced. It's neither, and definitely worth checking out, even if you're not sightseeing.The interior is rustic and bright. The service is just serviceable, but that's fine, given the casual air of the whole place. The English breakfast and its veggie counterpart are big and satisfying and, amazingly, relatively inexpensive.

6w9Q25GuwD5Ea9hqT4P0UA.text: English style breakfast. Low prices. Coffee not that great.

lXG98UTSW9ltYOXWE1S7Iw.text: Really quick, cheap and delicious. Amazingly not overrun with tourists given the location!

stG79Nw_MO-PmXDe2rEbbw.text: I was extremely pissed by one of the waiters. He forgot our order intentionally and let us wait for over 35 minutes. Does that simply because I asked for the early bird rate which is on their website and apparently he is not happy with?! In the middle of the wait, approx 20 mins, we asked him when we can have our food and he said I will bring it for you. Then he went back to serve other guests and didn't even look at us even when we purposely and constantly giving him the eye contacts. After 35-40 mins wait, we asked another waiter about our food and he immediately went back to the kitchen and checked for the order. Guess what? The first guy didn't put the order, obviously. Then two waiters had some chats and the first waiter didn't say anything or show any surprise to him, nor he showed any apologies to us. He seems careless. I came to London from the US but I believe this stupid waiter thought that I am some random Chinese/ Japanese girl who cannot speak English and doesn't understand Western culture or something. It was the most ridiculous dinning experience ever and I don't recommend anyone who wants a good service come here to eat. You will get mistreated by a racist.

O7wrCbzz_yoLroz5NFaDoA.text: I met two friends here and was surprised (I shouldn't have been, yelp would have told me) that there weren't a crown of Tower of London tourists considering the location. I had the vegetarian English breakfast and was very pleased with the vegetarian sausage, so fresh! Cute décor and nice staff!

3Fy1Kf9_viicpeayb_gXmg.text: Nice service and very friendly atmosphere. But the food could be a bit better. Had fish n chips and a club sandwich. Both were kinda "blah" and taste.

7l4rg1Wl0PVGEjDGOaccVw.text: Seated right next door to the Tower of London, in a little glass tinderbox building, this buzzing eatery attracts tourists and local business folks. Chose it for the locale and high rating on Trip Advisor. Didn't disappoint. Clotted cream with scone & jam £1.9. Ahhh. I licked the cream cup clean. We both had ham, eggs and chips £7.5 and cappuccinos £2.3. Sweet staff. One server clued us in to the fact that just through a nearby doorway, we could enter/view the oldest church in England. We checked it out before heading to the Tower. Very busy place. Was thrilled to see all the locals having lunch. I love the Brits with their ability to endure wine and ale lunches. God love 'em. Highly recommend. Cheap eats and filling. Cheers!

-cxxmLlVbqlV-UqWB_-qrQ.text: Where do I start?! The reception was amazing!!! It's as if the owner and I were long lost friends from Thailand! Neither of us are thai but you get the point. The staff were so friendly and relaxed. I had the champagne afternoon tea was lovely..... The range of cakes! Chocolate , ginger, lemon, walnut, coffe, Victoria.....My goodness! I almost yelled "HALLELUJAH!" when the food arrived. I attempted to devour them all but failed..... I must return and regain my dignity! I'd recommend this place ;)

qp188oVoh7i8vdlFF_yjYA.text: I came here with a group after a Power RIB trip on the Thames, had a pot of tea for one, I thought they'd got it wrong and given me a pot for two, but no, it was correct, would like to sea how big the pot for 2 is! Service was very good, probably as it wasn't that busy, from what I saw the lunchtime food looked great. Has a fairly trendy atmosphere feel to it and is glassed up with a nice outside area. Great location close to the Tower Millenium Pier. A simple menu but next time I'll try the food.

N7lcqhwepYUJLHubYU2CKw.text: This is an awesome spot for an English breakfast. Great tasting, good food for the money and friendly service.

RVlpeWGNDXPZb0pF0xXKyg.text: Great atmosphere, big glass windowed and rustic decoration with a good menu and very pleasant service

ukbfDXozbPQZ3CEyegCXdA.text: I work close to this cafe and have been in many times but shamefully haven't given them a review. They deserve lots of good ones!This is a lovely, friendly place, a totally wonderful alternative to the bland chains nearby. The menu includes homemade cakes (delicious) as well as more substantial dishes, but I've always stuck with the tea and cakes, to be honest.Although it does get busy, it never feels stressful, the staff are great, and it is sometimes a shock to walk out and realise you are still in the heart of the City, next door to one of London's busiest tourist attractions. Speaking of which, the prices at Kitchen are pretty reasonable, much more so than in the Tower of London, so I'd definitely recommend stopping here if you are visiting the castle.The cafe is also built on to the All Hallows by the Tower church, which is a fantastic tourist destination in its own right, and worth popping into too: qype.co.uk/place/133146-…

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

I0-rcFNWt8mQQft2QhB7Ww.text: This stylish cafe is between the All Hallows church and the Tower of London.We had a lovely breakfast here at brunch time, the service was cheerful, friendly and efficient, the food was tasty with reasonable size portions and the drinks we had (ginger beer and elderflower presse) were good quality.What is remarkable is that this cafe is right next to the Tower of London yet it is full of local workers having lunch with a minority of tourists, a good atmosphere and whilst busy it is not frenetic. We will visit again when we need a late breakfast or lunch.

ijUTBawwmiZCVZleXCSRbg.text: Food was ok, but the service was terrible. I would only recommend this place if there'd be no other option to go to.

1DB6FBJ8AgKer8-ZIjbddA.text: We got there around 1pm on a monday and it was really busy. We were told the restaurant was full and wait was 20-30 minutes. it ended up being ... 5 minutes. Worth the wait. Typical good English food: sausage with mashed potatoes, English breakfast at any time, excellent scones or apple tart witt English custard.Coming from the US, service is average, but isn't it anywhere in Europe...

hifo1sc5J1OJ6jdGK-K57A.text: This place is extremely welcome for the traveler who wants a breakfast of more than pastries.  They offer a true English breakfast that kept me fueled for hours.  Plus the lighting through the large windows helped to wake me up on the morning.  Service was very friendly. Coffee was pretty good.

8JcY1KKg01pIE8AiEY7-kw.text: The Kitchen turned out to be the best place to have breakfast in Great Britain during our 3-week trip across the whole country. Delicious food, friendly hostess. Very close to Tower, so if you are a traveler, you can plan to have breakfast here before visiting Tower.

xQGGFnsq277DbsQ6ZCx6IQ.text: Wish I could have found the location - unfortunately Apple Maps puts the restaurant on the other side of the street and it's not obvious when you are over there that the restaurant is behind the church.  I'm putting this out there to tell others that the location is literally attached to the church on the Tower side of the street. BTW:  Go into the small museum under the church - it's great.  I'm giving it 3 starts as average because of the following.  4 stars as that seems to be the consensus of the other reviews.  2 stars because when I called to find the location, the guy that answered rudely said "We are closed today due to a large party - and then he hung up without further comment"  I found it very off putting when I was just inquiring on where they were located.  Hopefully the food is good...

VcfuTrdIOnovJ09gAZRSNw.text: Location is breathtaking and the decor is light & spacious. For the price (just under £5) the bacon sandwich (bacon, butter & toast) left a little to be desired as the toast was burnt. I did have plate envy of the neighbouring tables though. The scrambled eggs were good-looking!

pifu7ejKf6dRA-T0LtFWXQ.text: Stopped by after a day touring the city. It was a cold Sunday late in the day.They had a nice deal a hot drink and cake for 3.95 . It hit the spot after a cold day. The staff was friendly ,it was close to closing time , they did not rush us. Enjoyed the hot drink and cake. Should try this place out.

mSNGMjhW9dFFZVwLYJUeCQ.text: Quickest breakfast we had-- and most filling.This place is great, because they're fast about serving you (which we found was a bit of an issue in London -- I think us Americans are used to in and out service, not leisure), and they're so so friendly. They did awesome little things like offering to just bring you a pitcher of (free) water to your group, rather than charge you for the water. We came back 3 /5 days we ate breakfast as we stayed at The Tower Hotel. Also it's insanely affordable. Great coffee. Wonderful food. A+ (Plus how cool is it to eat on the same property as an old church-- and the church has connections to William Penn, which I thought was cool since we're from PA!)

5HvhttSduAcpHufwue5BQw.text: I woke up this morning, looked at the washing I forgot to do the night before and swiftly decided to go out for brunch! A quick search on the Yelp app (casual plug there) and I found this place a couple of miles for me. Perfect!Set in a courtyard off a busy London road, this place gets some of the traffic noise but nevertheless aims to be relaxing and a bit quirky - lime green and pink chairs outside for a bit of colour. Obviously a popular place, it had a nice mix of business men On brunch meetings and casual tourist look-a-likes such as my beautiful self. Tea in a 'keep calm and carry on' mug I LOVE, casual crown on top to remind you how close you are to the Tower of London :)I had scrambled eggs on toast with bacon, very brunch I feel. Eggs were lovely, not runny or dry but that nice middle ground. On reflection the bacon wasn't needed but who can resist a free optional extra! Good quality bread, love a seeded loaf. Not 5 stars as it comes with a central London price tag unfortunately (as a northern boy I know I could get that cheaper).All in all, if I worked around here I could definitely see myself coming back on a weekly basis. As it is, now I know where to go if I wake up but dirty dishes again ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Love a mug of tea :D
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

KJPYl6abpGIQeEz4o62lhQ.text: What a lovely Place! Right in the middle of a very busy place full of tourists there is a very nice garden and a great Place to be. Food was ok but therefor a super friendly Service and great coffee.

nKIvtAYluwLueakuC-Tb0w.text: The Kitchen@tower is a lovely place to escape from the chaotic crowds around the tower of London. The high ceiling and big glass windows/walls allow natural lighting which in turn induce relaxing mood to the occupants; and that indeed was one of the reasons why I like this place. I also adore some of the kitschy/shabby chic decor and the oh so comfortable English wing chairs to settle at after a long day of walk. The leather couch was not too bad either. Sadly, I was disappointed by the food they serve. The taste is mediocre and lacking creativity. Thankfully the service is friendly and cheerful. For example of the servers made us the guests sing happy birthday to one of the young diner celebrating her 25th birthday there. This friendliness is not so common in London in my opinion so I am giving kudos to the Kitchen crew.Overall, the kitchen@tower is adorable and relaxing restaurant/cafe but I'll only recommend it  for its charm.

uYH8QpE0zeT5ZKPxcp45Vg.text: This place is ridiculously adorable.  I found it by doing a Yelp search for "breakfast" near our accomodation.  It was conveniently located just next to the tube and served fried breakfasts, so we were sold.  It was slightly hard to find due to being set back from the street, but this gave it a nice calm feeling despite being on a busy street in a touristy area.  The ceilings were high and three of the walls were almost entirely glass.  The decoration was kitchy and somewhat mismatched but in no way cluttered.  It was a good combination of cozy and calm, with light and airy.  The staff were lovely - with special mention of course to the owner? manager?  who was very attentive and generally adorable.  Our full breakfasts came very quickly, with *perfectly* cooked eggs (I'm annoying about my eggs and the white has to be totally cooked while the yolk needs to be runny), and just the right amount of food so you finish everything but don't feel like a slug after.  I passed on the sausage (and was offered extra bacon or a hash brown as an alternative) but The Man said it was very good quality.  We got the early bird special (before 11am, so really not that early!) which meant that two full breakfasts with a huge pot of tea was £13.00.  It was an unexpected bargain that after a weekend in London was definitely appreciated.  I'm going go out on a limb and say that I think this was the best full breakfast I've had in a cafe/restaurant in all of my years in the UK - good quality food that was well cooked and served in perfect quantity.  If you're in the area, definitely come here.

4WsXcwTRHQ0YpcniDJZ2TQ.text: This place is edible but nothing special.  Had bangers and mash , the fish and chips were bready.  Lasagne was kind of crusty

miTz0puHFVR3ZNMIM-ELhA.text: Friendly service, very very cute and clean location as well as fair prices. Was here on a Tuesday morning around 11am and place was almost empty. Filled up during our stay. We had vegetarian and gill English breakfast, both worth the money and fresh. Not extraordinarily well spiced, but salt and pepper are on the table, right? It is a bright place with huge windows to enjoy what is going on in the little garden. Enjoyed it and if I lived here this would probably become my favorite cafe to hang out.

FtdzSslPRRKPi-7SWVgusg.text: The Kitchen @ Tower is located in a very convenient location as it is very close to Tower Hill underground and next to tourist attractions such as the Tower of London and close to Tower Bridge. The food was well priced as we ordered the early bird special of a 'full english breakfast' for 6.50 pounds. The smoked salmon egg benedict on a toasted bun was also very good. If you're short on time and around for the attractions this is the place for you!

-t51uLUdrBWZqSqzOx5yqQ.text: With a special full english breakfast available and close to the Tower of London, it's a no brainer. Came here for brunch before our big day visiting this side of London. Convenient location with good warm food at an affordable price!

GGsDcOezPsukeYzpRfTyZw.text: A really nice place close to Tower Bridge, we were looking for a nice brunch place and ended up here.Nice and rather small place with friendly staff and a warm atmosphere, the menus are packed with goodies, as it was almost lunch time I felt like having a burger [how surprising]I ordered the beefeater burger and asked to change the egg to bacon, they did it and also free of charge- i'm impressed [along with my other usual request - no tomatoes :D].Everything was served rather quick and the staff was very nice with high service awarness!The burger is nicely served, with fries and salad, and my friend's english breakfast was pretty big.We also took some hash-browns as a side dish, yummy yummy!!!Despite the location the prices are fair and it's not too crowded, had a really nice time in that place, shame I was too full to get some dessert too. hopefully next time I drop by.

2qzStzAkAgWhPobKv6NEBg.text: If you want a quick, proper breakfast this is the place. The English Breakfast was delicious and affordable. Highly recommended for the backpacker looking for a quick breakfast before exploring. Right next to the Tower of London as well. Very convenient.

WafrCTNkqhFx5EvBuFPGVQ.text: Great spot behind the ticketing area of the Tower and attached to the oldest church in London. The food was decent and they had a good price for an English breakfast. Staff was friendly, and food was delivered quickly. When we were done, I decided not to wait for service and just went to the counter to pay. It's all very casual and a perfect start to a day at the Tower.

O_gkTn36c7lF2qora_iSxA.text: Had the English breakfast and it was quite good. Everything came out hot and fresh and with the coffee or tea included it is quite a good deal. My son had the fish and chips which he didn't care for much as the fish lacked flavor but the chips were crisp and delicious.

hw5QEFgOkr7SWkjLRsLWrw.text: Friendly staff, accommodating. Always remember to fill the water for my pot of tea. Charming little place. Reminds me of having tea in a conservatory.

m92yHW6FTLv0hi9ndo16lA.text: Surprisingly good breakfast for what by all accounts should be a tourist-filled, overpriced cafe in sight of The Tower of London.But instead of all that, it's actually a cute, quiet little cafe with tons of natural light and a very reasonably priced breakfast menu. I had the veggie English breakfast, which despite the pseudo oxymoron, was amazing. Eggs, beans on toast, mushrooms, grilled tomatoes, hash browns and veggie sausage with coffee for £8.50.I wouldn't go quite so far as to call it a 'hidden gem', but it's definitely worth a visit if you're in the area and desperate for a restaurant that isn't advertised by a gent wearing a giant sign and shouting about chips.

jxyejADSRhrtlydiYdo6hw.text: Best value of full English breakfast in London! 6.5 pound including drink early special when you order before 11 am. Its even toast there and no extra charge for baked bean and mushroom (although its not the lovely black one) It's a cute green house in the garden. Service is great and they know how to make latte too. It would be a shame for me not to write a review here since I really had a great experience here!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. I don't expect the latte is that good too!
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. It looks lovely !

dfBgrRE4o7PoKNJQSkidjA.text: Stopped in for breakfast as this cafe is just a 2 minute walk from our hotel. Quiet, secluded spot that is nestled next to All Hallows' Church. Bright, fun, kitschy decor. Food was delicious. Boyfriend had the Kitchen Sink and I had scrambled eggs with smoked salmon on toast. We both enjoyed our food very much and were stuffed at the end. Just the toast alone was delicious - everything else was an added bonus. Prices were good and there's even an early bird special on the Full English if you're in before 11am. Highly recommended.

AlBj1upcRP3gauX6nHJEDw.text: Nice, quick, cheap meal if you're going to visit the Tower or coming back from it. The English breakfast is small but cheap, ~£7. The only downside is the service. The waiter was doing everyone else's job (the busser, specifically) and as a result everything slowed down. As with all our meals in London, you have to hail the servers down when you want to leave.

0W1Dq4NA1yvW90mRbaeVzQ.text: We stopped by the kitchen before going into the Tower of London for a quick bite to eat. This was our first experience in the UK in a restaurant and I'll say we weren't disappointed! Service was quick and friendly. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich and swapped the chips for a salad without a problem or extra charge. My husband got the fish and chips and our friend got a burger.While my chicken came out bland (at this point it seems to be all the chicken in England is bland...) I will say the toppings were fresh and the roll was DELICIOUS. There's nothing worse than ordering a sandwich and the bread is gross... This was not the case here. I didn't have a taste of the fish nor did I taste the burger, but both looked delicious. My friend who ate the burger said it was tasty, while my husband said the fish was just "okay." Not something I expected at Ochoa first fish and chips meal in England!If you need a quick bite to eat near the tower this place will do. They also have a lovely garden with seating for a nice day.

tOulEt4OEs0zZp6mugaZ2w.text: Got in before 11 am to get the Early Bird English Breakfast. Location was amazing! Food and tea were delicious! Would recommend!

OmMT7hPVnijVj9jvzLtNfw.text: Great service and lovely garden ambiance just steps from the Thames near the Tower of London. Loved the chicken sandwich! The only reason I have it a 4 is because the BLT wasn't the way I'm used to having it in the states- bread wasn't toasted and the bacon was slabs instead of strips. I would absolutely go again and get the chicken sandwich.

3_S48IEwTmcw54RBWPN9kQ.text: This is a great and affordable option. They use organic ingredients that are locally sourced. Service was friendly and food was perfectly prepared. They have a great English breakfast before 11am for 6.5 pounds! This is an incredible deal versus any other "real" breakfast in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Eggs Benedict
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast

MMCfqEgaoAWwUvnnNc8k5g.text: I was very disappointed by this restaurant. I'm not sure if I picked the wrong menu item (English muffins with avocado, grilled tomatoes and poached eggs) but it was very bland. I'm not sure if it matters...the service sucked so they'd still get two stars. The only things this place had going for it was the location if you need to eat before a tour of the Tower of London, and the fact that it was quiet (see sucky service) so I could read peacefully.

Qn52LnOSNUB58rvHI8mE2w.text: Really enjoyed the breakfast here.  Service was a little slow  - but that was probably because it is bank holiday and they were not fully staffed.

G-c-j-74WkgBNaokHW_xrw.text: This was a great place to get a traditional English breakfast.  Very enjoyable!  The restaurant is literally right next door to All Hallows Church.  Great place to start the morning before heading to the Tower of London.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

1_g-O6KHHNrxTzFI5rrLhg.text: Lovely space with mediocre British fare.  Name has changed to "Byward." Fish and chips were heavy with grease, everything way under-seasoned. Staff was pleasant, though, and we enjoyed the visit on a rainy day after touring the Tower.

Mn3ORAm3IISYirC1y1KiUw.text: Walking distance from the Tower of London and directly across the street from the Citizen M that I stayed at, I must say that this place for breakfast was great way to start day. We entered the restaurant around 8:30 am and greeted and immediately seated by our hostess. The first thing that really struck me about this place was the overall ambiance of it. The restaurant itself is situated in a relatively large building but conveys a really warm and cozy atmosphere. The decor was modern and the patio looked beautiful despite the drizzle of rain. Given that this was our first time in the U.K., we knew we had to have the full English breakfast. They also had an interesting list of coffee/speciality drinks/wine/beer selection from the bar. The most tempting and the thing that I regret not ordering was this Irish coffee with a shot Baileys in it. Anyways, the two orders of the full English breakfast comes and man did that thing look bomb. Two rashes of back bacon, a sausage, a perfectly looked sunny side up egg, mushrooms, a hash brown triangle, roast tomato, baked beans, black pudding, and toast. Despite never having tomatoes, beans, and tomatoes for breakfast before, I must say that the flavor profile of each item complimented one another very well. The black pudding, a first, but given that I am asian and have eaten pork blood in my rice congee, was appealing to me and actually pretty good. That sausage and the beans though were definitely the highlight for me. The bacon was almost like Canadian bacon and the only thing that I think that the American breakfast wins at. Overall, everything on that plate was amazing and I wish I could have this every morning here in the states. The only thing that I wish they did differently was to give you two slices of toast. One slice of toast was not sufficient and my brother and I even debated if we should added a croissant prior to ordering. If I knew they gave you one slice of toast, I definitely would added another carb to my order. Highly recommend this place. Another awesome thing about this place was they did not automatically add the 12% service charge to your bill so bring some pounds to tip because they definitely provide excellent service.

Ib3AZxoF1QA_ya10AE7RCQ.text: My girlfriend and I visited this small establishment before visiting London Tower. Excellent English breakfast (including coffee) for only £6.5 pounds if you manage to make it in before 11 am.  The day before we spent £13 pounds each on a breakfast that wasn't as good. The waiter was attentive, polite and welcoming. Excellent meal for an excellent price!!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast for only 6.5 per person.(before 11 am)

u5temJ6A-mv8T4dD4QhKbw.text: Delish food with an awesome English breakfast, the service was great and prices weren't bad at all. Even though we didn't get to enjoy sitting outside( rain of course) it still was adorable inside. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Espresso!
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Cute decor
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu

Jau2EyXBNCC_iynxd-BHiA.text: Thank you, Yelpers, for another fantastic find. Everything about this place is brilliant: from the staff, to the food, and especially the location and ambience. It's homey and bright. Best of all the prices aren't catered for tourists. Lovely spot and The Tower is literally steps away. Bravo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. This is The Kitchen Sink, as in everything but! Very Full English Brekkie!!

m65shXahoRo2olYvj8pGQA.text: New name. Byward Kitchen and Bar. I love love love this place, very pleasant and warm! The people are so friendly and the drinks are amazing!!!! I got a gin fizz and it was wonderful. My mother got a carrot cake, and it was also very good! Great ice cubes too :) they have blankets for warmth and a nice outdoor space! Good food and good drinks near the tower, but not super touristy, which was surprising!

UtdYDH9bqIIdc00hbWKBhA.text: We came here for breakfast early in the morning before our visit to the Tower of London. It was an all-around wonderful experience - very friendly staff, delicious and affordable food, and the best porridge we've had to date. After trying this porridge, we've sampled - in vain - countless of other versions throughout the UK and Ireland, and nothing comes close. Now that we're home, we're still trying to replicate that perfect balance of sweet and savory, creamy but substantial, and rich without being too heavy.ATMOSPHERE: 4/5SERVICE: 5/5FOOD: 5/5VALUE: 5/5OVERALL: 5/5

jotHeozqAbGw0UzjdFWXrQ.text: Close to London tower and we were so hungry that I just chose this one to dine in.  The chicken burger was so small and cost 11.5 ponds.  The breakfast was just okay.  The waiter was nice, but the food did not reach my expectation.  Over price and not worth it.  Will no go back again!

kC3gczoESpqA21RumScD8w.text: We thought we'd try a proper English breakfast instead of our hotel breakfast(that was included) one morning on our vacation. Why can't one get really good eggs in London? And why do they have this fascination with beans? We got the English breakfasts without beans. They were ok. The staff was very nice. And the location is right around the corner from the Tower Of London.

J8tcgVcMbVZjZ1nuo_aZJA.text: The food here is okay. I went on a day they were low staffed. It took them about 15 minutes to come back to us after we were seated. We got our food and brought our juices. Mango juice is amazing. They did apologize for the service and what not which is always nice. The place itself is cute has a lot of room. I would recommend coming here as I don't believe the service is always that slow

ylwqyl5yiHnHxFKQVOd6Jw.text: What a solid breakfast spot.  I tried the vegetarian breakfast last week and was not disappointed.  The eggs were cooked nicely and the variety of beans, avocado, fried haloumi cheese and other items was excellent.

CiuzeQUHUsPwtGBqIHrYoQ.text: Friendly, bright, cheerful and inexpensive. If you feel guilty about eating a full English, there's a church next door. Many of the patrons were Americans. This didn't spoil things.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Lovely place to get food next to a church and within 4 minutes walk to Tower Bridge.

aFIj79scX2M3j7Y7HeTAyw.text: I almost feel bad posting a 2 star review when others have had such inexplicably great experiences! We went on a Tuesday around late noon, the place was still about half full with the lunch crowd. After reading all of the reviews below we had good expectations even though it's kind of a 'tourist trap' restaurant by the Tower.Let's start with our server. He was particularly abysmal. Maybe he'd just given up after dealing with non-tipping tourists day after day. After our food was dropped off we didn't see him again. Literally, he was no where to be found. Nor did anyone else check on us, and we sat for ages before going up to a random counter-staffer to ask for our bill and pay (we saw other people getting bills to their table so we expected this was standard procedure and waited). So no points for service. Let's move on to the food. My friend and I both figured we'd be a little typical and get some good old English fish and chips. The place had good reviews so it'll be good, right? So wrong. Coming from the Atlantic coast of Canada I'm pretty well versed in battered haddock. This fish tasted like pure nothingness. Sooooo so so bland and disappointing. The tartar sauce tasted like your typical grocery store variety and we weren't even offered lemon or vinegar as per standard English custom. Chips (or 'fries' for us Canadian folk) were decent, but with our lack of server we had to get up, do a little sleuth work, and steal a bottle of ketchup from a wayward tray stand instead of getting our waiter to fetch some for us. As I mentioned, our waiter never checked on our meal so we didn't even have the opportunity to voice a complaint.We paid (with no tip, sorry bud!) and left. Coincidentally, there was another Canadian couple beside us who we chatted with and they brought up the same complaints.Maybe the breakfast everyone raves about below is worth it... but I would seriously never go here again.

SspzNtfu1E-3rdLiC9uQgg.text: Great food and service. I had the English breakfast and it was excellent. Hearty meal a easy location to the London Tower area A must try, when in London

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Scone with berries and creme
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Classic English Breakfast

J_fVFI7S0Qc1yQduO_5sAg.text: Very nice establishment. Came by here after searching for breakfast in the area. There aren't a lot of trendy cafes but this one definitely fits the bill. It is a bit hard to find but they do make an effort to put flags out on Byward Street. Service is quick so it's great for people who work around here to get in, have their breakfast and the way out. It's very bright and I think it is a great place to host events as it has extremely high ceiling with tall windows all 3 corners of the cafe. I was hoping for eggs benedict but they didn't offer it so got the english breakfast instead. Early bird special is only 6.5pounds and it also includes coffee! SUPER deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Enter through the gates with the lime green flags. It is on south side of the street
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Menu

HQnfHDevMUEsfQUNphAE3w.text: - Great place for breakfast before lining up for the Tower of London. Came in on a Monday morning and we were the only ones there for a while before other people started trickling in. - Decor is very cute- First time trying a full english breakfast and it was delicious, very, very filling, and everything I imagined a full english breakfast would be- The lemon and ginger tea is SO GOOD- Service was great and very patient to tourists who can't count pounds correctly :)

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Full english with breakfast tea

j0hvEnHKlcZerWzAPckzRg.text: Byward kitchen is a favourite.Love the fact that1. It is so central, yet feels so cut off from the hustle and bustle2. The gorgeous historic church it is attached to3. The amazing food4. The super friendly service5. Those fantastic windows - we have experienced them in all kinds of weather, I must admit, my favourite is when it rains.6. Fantastic coffeeGreat food, coffee, ambiance, service, surroundings. What's not to love.We recommend this place to every set of friends who are headed to the tower of london whether for breakfast, early lunch or late lunch. Every single one of them has loved it!Given that I've tried most of the food options inside the Tower of London, I know how much better the food at Byward is and is a wonderful oasis of calm before or after braving the touristic throngs

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

I7Z3HcP8-WSn1xw5wFsnVA.text: Finally got my full English breakfast! The cafe and service were lovely. I've been so excited to try it and overall it was a hearty and heavy experience.Why I was here // located right next to the Tower if London, and as tourists we wanted to eat somewhere nearby so we can hit up the attraction Atmosphere // we ate there around 10am on a Tuesday. It wasn't overly crowded which was really nice and the interior felt clean and welcoming Service // super friendly Food/ drink // -English breakfast tea // I love tea! And breakfast tea is always how I start my mornings. Comes in a pot and I served with milk and sugar. Yumm! -full English breakfast // very hearty and personally a bit too heavy. Lots of meat and the blood sausage thing was not as bad as I thought! The beans and mushrooms were probably my fave next to the sausage and hash brown. The bacon and blood part were on the saltier side. Egg was nicely cooked. Overall // I think I prefer a breakfast filled with veggies and fruits rather than meat, but it was a nice experience and I'm so happy I got to try it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast (bread was on a separate plate)

qIhb8u1Cnp3S53hhOXWJVQ.text: Bywater was great! The setting was perfect to grab a bite after visiting the Tower of London. Service was attentive and food delicious. I can only speak to a few dishes. The bangers and mash was excellent. Good flavor on the sausage with a nice gravy on a bed of mashed potatoes. Another at our table had the standard English breakfast and loved it.

6rKcbCrl9uOKijhmE-V_Fg.text: It really is a cute little oasis as other reviewers mentioned.  A bit hidden at first, as it is next to a church. Like the glass windows and available outdoor seating. I'm glad I got to try an English breakfast while I was around the area. Definitely order their English breakfast here. We also ordered the egg benedict, which I thought was just okay. Nothing too special. On a side note, customer service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

qMru5LHv7FIiQubPD4n1_A.text: Yelp 100 Challenge 2017 80/100This cute little restaurant was right across from our apartment so we went on the last day, with all of our luggage. The outside seating area is nice and is nearly the same size as inside. I thought the food was fine- nothing amazing but the prices were reasonable. I tried the big breakfast. I cannot get use to the "bacon", which is more like ham, but too gamey for me. The orange juice tastes really artificial. One thing that stood out for me here was that the waiter was really friendly. I think it was the first time a waiter actually smiled at us in London. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

KSoqBcgSsGzzCC-rF2KfMw.text: Cute little oasis right by the Tower of London and Tower Bridge but somehow not busy even though it's in the middle of a massive tourist spot. Really great back patio, fantastic service and really credible food made it exactly what we were looking for for a quick lunch before our Tower of London tour.Really enjoyed the very traditional fish and chips - fish was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. Bangers and mash was also a hit from across the table as were a number of the other - some not as traditional - menu items that we sampled.They did a good job of managing tastes for our kids as well and overall just knocked our service out of the park.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. The bangers and mash. Banging.
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. A really great fish and chips.

-B_m9kUp-Prvq75mW8UcZw.text: Unbeknownst to us, this is the cafe for the All Hallows by the Tower church, the oldest church in the city of London. It is a small cafe located behind the church, across from a square with bigger chain restaurants. We would have never stopped by had it not been for the Yelp reviews.What was appealing about the menu is that they serve traditional English breakfast all day as well as other English classics such as fish and chips. Food and service were good and it was a good place to relax before heading out to tour the Tower of London. Thanks to all previous Yelp reviewers, would definitely recommend to others!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. English breakfast

BwMOZwFBppFfIzqA4GOQ4A.text: I wish there were more of The Kitchen's across London. I loved the décor of this place the second I walked in, it was quaint and comfortable & the service was good. My English Breakfast was superb! The portion was big, so if you are a big breakfast eater, then this is the place to go. I ordered an Americano and it came out hot & steaming, not to mention it was extremely good. One thing about The Kitchen is that it is a bit on the expensive side so I suggest coming here if you plan on eating a big breakfast, I couldn't finish my meal but what I did eat of it was delicious. I'd say that they are definitely worth checking out if you are in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Love the decor!
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. The English breakfast! Yum.

eGX2UDz3RfRHxw1rdP576Q.text: I got the full English breakfast and it was pretty good. The staff are very friendly and the restaurant looks like part of the church, which was nice. It's really close to the Tower of London, so if that's on your to-do list, give this place a try.

W0HTuOSh-OVDP7bjBX-4JA.text: Great breakfast on a beautiful patio. We met a girlfriend of mine here for breakfast on a Tuesday. We got there around opening time but because I forgot to tell her that the name of the place changed to Byward, she was a little late. Our server was great, got us drinks and waited till she came for us to order. I got the English breakfast and added haloumi. Hubby got the salmon and eggs Benny and my friend got the vegetarian breakfast. They all looked delicious and mine tasted delicious! Everything was cooked perfectly.

Fwc5EfFo6_N1bkB96nQGlw.text: Made a reservation for afternoon tea after visiting the Tower of London and it was magical! Staff was super attentive and friendly, food and tea was to die for (and a great price to boot), and atmosphere was cozy. Definitely felt full and happy afterwards and they even let me take my treats to go when I didn't finish them all. Thanks for the great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea

BbLyWo4Rh0drGWmuuIlzbA.text: Great breakfast in London! They had different offerings for any sized appetite. A truly enjoyable proper English breakfast. The staff was welcoming and attentive. Interesting space next to London's oldest church. Try it soon!

JbvxB2O0O0SpRaXxmbZuOQ.text: Nothing remarkable as far as Food goes ...  I got the French toast, and BF got a mushy egg dish.  The mushy eggs were a little gross.  Service was very friendly, and it's on the river, so it's a nice view.It was like a maze trying to find this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

DipR3GL0HfAUhjTitr40ww.text: I like this place. It looks weird and underwhelming when you first walk in. It has the tell tale signs of a bad place, all those small signs out front directing you inside. We didn't have much of a choice as we needed a quick place to get brunch before going into Tower of London. I found this on Yelp and the reviews were solid. So is my review.The service was prompt and good. They're so friendly. I ordered a cup of tea with English breakfast and hash brown. It was really good! Nothing fancy, just the true English style breakfast you expect, done right. It reminded me of my childhood, eating this sort of brekky in Australia. I didn't try the coffee though, as I'm particular with my coffee as it has to be hipster as generally they're the best.The atmosphere is good. It's bright, airy and the garden was nice. Best thing about it is how cheap this place is! I will definitely have to come back as the price to quality ratio is high.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

8va6U2LCMIXm6SsHtQsNFw.text: This beautiful restaurant feels like a glass house, connected to All Hallows by the Tower, which is the oldest church in the City of London. Great meal and wonderful staff here! Our waiter was so helpful and friendly, offering tips on getting around the city and what to see. Really nice full English breakfast as well, washed down with a Bloody Mary. The Vegetarian breakfast was also lovely, with grilled halloumi cheese, avocado, egg (fried or scrambled), mushrooms, hash brown, roast tomato, toast & butter. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom

PpzRB_cXuoMpi9kXtmaPGA.text: A neat little spot situated near the tower bridge. I had a chance to try the full English breakfast and they did not disappoint. The staff was super friendly and I'll be back on my next business trip to London. Cheers!

AIQxj5s27oC1YEyO-1FBKQ.text: This is such a great place. Very quaint and neat view inside. We came in to get out of the rain and enjoy a bite - but honestly the food was much better than expected and the atmosphere was very pleasant. Highly recommend!

X0tQ8u0-ELJvQdTzNmx41g.text: Excellent! Walked right in at 10am on Sunday. Friendly efficient service and a delicious English breakfast. And just steps from the Tower of London!

KWoH3_NgjmfDXLTK8ANsSw.text: Loved this cafe! Stopped here on my first morning in London to chow down on my first English breakfast EVER. I was looking forward to the black pudding and it did not disappoint. Great place to read a book and enjoy your meal or catch up with friends. Great price for a great meal - was able to order the early bird special, what a steal! Service was great. Very warm and friendly to this solo traveler!

photos.caption: Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Made it just in time for the early bird special!
Photo of Byward Kitchen & Bar - London, United Kingdom. Great breakfast!!
